result.execSummary:
The defendant Earl M. Loman Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Firearm by Felon [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Portage County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 
  If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time.

Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  Steven Lehman nor any other person who is a known user of controlled substances
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to controlled substances.
Do not take controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Do not possess any firearms or other dangerous weapons.

Comply with any other conditions and recommendations as recommended by the agent. 
Defendant to be sent to Milwaukee to MSDF.

supervisions.notes:
*Eligible for the Substance Abuse Program
*Eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program

Concurrent with: Concurrent with 12CF15

superMiscConds.notes:
*Pay costs
*Pay DNA Surcharge
*If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy.
*Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.

*Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
*Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.
*Do not possess any firearms or other dangerous weapons.

*Participate in any counseling or assessments as recommended and at the discretion of the Agent
*Continue to comply/participate with any AODA Treatment Programming in the community

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Earl M. Loman in court with attorney Travis S Slattery. Defendant Earl M. Loman in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

8:41 a.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.

Court and counsel have received their copies of the Revocation packet(s) and Warrant
Atty Slattery does not have any corrections or additions to the Revocation packet/Warrant
Assistant DA argues regarding sentencing
Attorney for the defendant argues regarding sentencing
Defendant does not make a statement prior to sentencing

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 -
Impose a 6 year prison sentence - to run concurrent to 12CF15
3 years of initial confinement
385 days of sentence credit
Eligible for the Substance Abuse Program
Eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
3 years of extended supervision
**Conditions of Extended Supervision:
*Pay Court Costs 
*Pay DNA Surcharge
*Do not possess any firearms or other dangerous weapons.
*Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.
*Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
*Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.
*Participate in any counseling or assessments as recommended and at the discretion of the agent.
*Continue to comply/particiapte with any AODA Treatment Programming in the community

Defendant is remanded to the Portage County Sheriff's Department
Atty Travis Slattery appointed
Sentencing hearing on revocation on September 29, 2017 at 09:00 am.
(copied to ADA CC/SPD 8-28/kp)

Defendant Earl M. Loman in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Defendant Earl M. Loman in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 15CF197 and 15CF222.

10:37 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CF197:
Count 1 - Guilty

15CF222:
Count 1 - Guilty
Count 2 - DRI
Count 3 - DRI

Court did not accept the No Contest Plea's so defendant pleads Guilty.
Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1 of 15CF197 and Count 1 of 15CF222 and Counts 2 & 3 on 15CF222 are DRI.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Court requests a PSI.  
Atty Cousins makes statements that they were  going to go to sentencing as of today's date.
Court questions why the defendant will be going to Milwaukee.
Atty Cousins makes additional statements indicating that the defendant will be sent to Milwaukee for in patient drug treatment.
Case's will be going to sentencing today and no PSI will be required.

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty McFarland makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes statement prior to his sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
15CF197:
Count 1 -
Sentence withheld 
Placed on Probation for 36 months
No conditional jail requested 
Pay Court Costs 
Pay DNA Surcharge
Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  Steven Lehman nor any other person who is a known user of controlled substances
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to controlled substances.
Do not take controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Do not possess any firearms or other dangerous weapons.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time.
Comply with any other conditions and recommendations as recommended by the Agent
Defendant to be sent to Milwaukee to MSDF.
43 days jail credit
Defendant provided with Appeal information; has 20 days to appeal.

15CF222:
Count 1 -
Withhold sentence
Placed on Probation for 36 months
Comply with conditions in 15CF197

Count 2 - DRI
Count 3 - DRI
Pre-trial conference at 08-17-2015 08:30 am

Defendant Earl M. Loman in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Defendant Earl M. Loman in custody. ADA Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases 15CF222 and 15CF197 are heard today.
Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing on both cases.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

Arraignment for both cases.  State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Atty McFarland
Preliminary hearing at 07-13-2015 03:00 pm

Not possess any dangerous weapons. 
Not possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription. 
This bond covers both 15CF197 & 15CF222.

Bond amended from signature bond to cash bond.  New condition added: Surrender all firearms to the Portage County Sheriff's Department after making arrangements with them.

Defendant Earl M. Loman appeared by video.  Attorney Erik John Mcfarland in court. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 15CF197, 15CF222

Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.

State recommends a cash bond with conditions as stated.
Court notes there is a signature bond in both files. 
State recommends to convert that bond to a cash bond. 
Court notes defendant refused to sign.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance at 07-06-2015 01:30 pm

Not possess any dangerous weapons. 
Not possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription. 
This bond covers both 15CF197 & 15CF222.

Defendant Earl M. Loman appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 15CF197, 15CF222

Court questions if the defendant has seen the public defender. 
Defendant indicates he had someone contact them last week but no one is there. 
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaints.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaints.

Court will continue the defendant's appearance for the benefit of counsel to be present.  
Court informs the defendant to contact the Public Defender immediately after this hearing. 

State recommends a $5,000 signature bond. 

  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
